title: "Bounty splitting enabled" can discloses if public VDPs are running private VRP

profile.name: HackerOne
profile.about: Vulnerability disclosure should be safe, transparent, and rewarding.

vulnerability_information:
Hello Everyone,

I hope all is safe and you're safe in this pandemic,
and I hope this won't bother you like my previous submitions lol ,


## _Description_ :
The **"allows_private_disclosure"** resource in team for private team that have a public profile is shown there which discloses that this program have a private VRP if they're enabling "Bounty Splitting" to their private bug bounty program,
I'm not 100% sure cause I accidently found that ████████ shows that they're enabling bounty splitting but they runs a VDPs and that made me think that they're running a private VRP with that ,
████

_______________________________________________________________________________________________________________________
_______________________________________________________________________________________________________________________

## _Steps To Reproduce:_

1. Go to  █████████
2. You'll notice that they have bounty splitting option enabled though they're running a VDP
3. This refers that they runs a private VRP with that option enabled

███


**NOTE** : As said in the description I'm not totally sure if this a mistake or an actual bug cause I don't have the ability to try it on my own,
if it's just a mistake giving me the free to self-close this report will be too much apperciatable :)

_______________________________________________________________________________________________________________________
_______________________________________________________________________________________________________________________

## Impact

Ability to know that a team runs an invite only VRP if they're enabling bounty splitting option,


Thanks for taking your valuable time to read and validate this report,
All the best,

activities.message:
Hi @sodium_,

Thank you for your submission. I hope you are well. Your report is currently being reviewed and the HackerOne triage team will get back to you once there is additional information to share.

Have a great day! 

Kind regards,
@chinch1lla

Hey @sodium_,

After review, there doesn’t seem to be any security risk and/or security impact as a result of the behavior you are describing.

The "bounty splitting" feature is meant to be for collaborators to be invited to the report. The fact bounties can be awarded is simply an additional feature to it. The feature itself does not indicate whether the program awards bounties.

As a result, we will be closing this report as informative. This will not have any impact on your Signal or Reputation score. We appreciate your effort and look forward to seeing more reports from you in the future. 

Kind regards,
@chinch1lla

Hey @chinch1lla ,

Thank you so much or taking care out of reps I apperciate it,
However I know what does this feature designed for , the reason why I filled this report cause Hackerone have some graphql objects that does not have a proper access control and show them to hackers that are not invited or being part of the targeted program ,
as example :
* In #707406 : The "industry" object is being shown to hackers whose are not participating on the targeted programs and with it the hacker was able to fingerpint whether this extrnal/public program have private part

* In #871142 : The "retest" object is being shown to hackers whose are not participating in the program and also with it @haxta4ok00 was able to know if extrnal/public program have private part

In my report I'm telling the same thing with **"allows_bounty_splitting"** is being shown to the public and it refers to the private part of the program, 

And you note **"The feature itself does not indicate whether the program awards bounties"** , VDPs usually have no way to edit bounty settings because they're hosting a response program (the same like bounty-table, SLA for bounty ...etc)


Thank you for taking this into consideration,
All the best,

Adam,

Hey @chinch1lla ,

The **""allows_bounty_splitting""** is actually have no access control , today I've came across with external program and have a private part with "bounty splitting enabled" and it successfully returned it to me as well and with hackers are able to know if external/public program have a private part (the same impact of  #707406 ,#871142) 

and security impact is "Privacy Violation" programs does not want their private program to be known and with it hackers can violate this privacy (the issue is in Hackerone),

the program is "██████" :

██████████

Please give it another look and sorry for the disturb,
All the best

Hello @chinch1lla and Everyone,

I have created a tool ████ you just need to give it a text file contains the handles of teams you want to know if they runs private part or not (public VDPs and external programs), also it make 2 requests per seconds so it won't disturb your servers and also won't detected by the rate limit on the /graphql endpoint,


* usage : hackerone.py handles.txt

it will tells you if the targeted team have private program running if they have "bounty splitting" option enabled,


see the video :
█████████

with this will be helpfull,
and thanks for taking this into consideration,

All the best

Hi @sodium_

We're discussing this submission with the internal team. We'll update you and take the appropriate action on the report once we hear back from them.

Thank you for your understanding,
@chinch1lla
Thank you Chinchilla for letting me know  !!

Hi @sodium_ - ha, this looks like a data migration gone wrong. We recently introduced this label for all problems and it turns out that we enabled it for some VDPs as well (non-bounty programs). There's not a private program linked to █████. What this means is that you'll be able to add collaborators to reports submitted to this program, but since bounties won't be awarded, nothing will happen. We're in the process of rebranding this feature to Collaboration. We're aiming to introduce additional features, like splitting reputation. Because of that, we're going to keep this closed as Informative. Please let us know if you believe I forgot something. Good luck and happy hacking!

Hi @jobert ,

Thanks for reaching out , but ████ is not a public VDP , they're  external program that runs a private part ,
if you go to ██████████ which is external but you can see "bounty splitting enabled" this will make us know that they're running private program and will violate their privacy, 
█████

so with the issue you described it means that if private program that have external part is enabling collaboration this will help us to know that they're running private program,

this have the same impact of  #707406 and #871142 (and many others) ,

Thanks for taking this into considration ,
All the best,


Adam

Thanks for taking this into consideration,
All the best,
Hi @sodium_ - you're right, I'm sorry! We're reopening this ticket and will escalate it to the engineering team that is responsible for this feature. Thanks for your persistence!

Hi @sodium_ - we'll take a look. Going forward, if you have concerns or questions about other reports, please follow up on the report itself. Please don't divert the discussion, since we need to redact it when it'll be publicly disclosed. Thanks for your understanding.

Hey, It's really cool how this was fixed too quick


* **_Summary_** :
Yes the fix works, the **"allows_bounty_splitting"** resource in team object is now have a proper access control and only shown to the hackers that are participating in that private program,

* **_Details_** :
The problem now fixed and when we try to fetch the **"allows_bounty_splitting"** resource of external team that have a private part, the requested data will be given to hackers that only participating in that program,
by submitting this query that was responsible for this harm when we re-test it again with a account that is not part of that private program and with account that is participant of that private program we'll get those results:

```http
POST /graphql HTTP/1.1
User-Agent: Mozilla 5.0
Host: hackerone.com
X-Auth-Token: ----
Content-Type: application/json
Content-Length: 72

{"query":"query{team(handle:\"xxxxx\"){allows_bounty_splitting}}"}     
```

Where xxxxx is the handle of the external program that runs private program, Unlike previously both of hackers that are/or-not participating in the program will get either true or false response but after the fix if you're not participating in the program you'll receive this response :

```javascript
{"data":{"team":{"allows_bounty_splitting":null}}}
```

and if you're participating on that program you'll get either "true" or "false" ,

```javascript
{"data":{"team":{"allows_bounty_splitting":true}}}
```

And that's the proper solution !!

Hope this will be helpfull,
All the best,

Hi @jobert,

I'm sorry for discussing the issue of other report here ,

anyway I've reached in there ,
thanks for letting me know :)

summaries.content: "Bounty splitting enabled" can discloses if ~~public VDPs~~ "external programs" are running private ~~VRP~~ part.
